text: Blowhard, is a rural locality 17.7 km (10.99827 statute miles) from Ballarat, in South Western Victoria, Australia. It is located between Creswick and Learmonth. Blowhard was once a prominent mining area. The name blowhard is a term commonly used to describe a pompous person. Mt Blowhard Primary School was erected by the Education Department in 1878 and is still operating as a primary school. At the 2016 census, Blowhard had a population of 84. ==References== Category:Ballarat Category:Mining towns in Victoria (Australia)
title: Blowhard, Victoria
